issues.title: [Pipeline] Project Scaffold ‚Äî Next.js 14 + TypeScript + Tailwind + Vitest
issues.body:
## Description

Bootstrap the DevCard Next.js 14 project with all required dependencies and configuration. This is the foundation for all other features.

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] `package.json` with all dependencies: `next`, `react`, `react-dom`, `tailwindcss`, `framer-motion`, `@octokit/rest`, `html-to-image`, `@vercel/og`, and dev dependencies: `vitest`, `@testing-library/react`, `@testing-library/jest-dom`, `@vitejs/plugin-react`, `typescript`, `@types/react`, `@types/node`, `eslint`, `autoprefixer`, `postcss`
- [ ] `tsconfig.json` extending `next/core-js` with strict mode enabled and path alias `"@/*"` mapping to `"src/*"`
- [ ] `tailwind.config.ts` configured for `src/` directory with `darkMode: "class"`
- [ ] `postcss.config.js` with tailwindcss and autoprefixer
- [ ] `src/app/layout.tsx` with HTML root, `dark` class on `(html)`, Inter font from `next/font/google`, metadata title `"DevCard"`
- [ ] `src/app/page.tsx` with placeholder heading `"DevCard"`
- [ ] `src/app/globals.css` with Tailwind directives (`@tailwind base/components/utilities`) and dark theme CSS variables (`bg-gray-950`, `text-gray-100`)
- [ ] `next.config.js` with `images.remotePatterns` allowing `avatars.githubusercontent.com`
- [ ] `vercel.json` with `{ "framework": "nextjs" }`
- [ ] `vitest.config.ts` with jsdom environment and setup file importing `@testing-library/jest-dom`
- [ ] npm scripts: `"dev"` (next dev), `"build"` (next build), `"start"` (next start), `"test"` (vitest run)
- [ ] `src/app/__tests__/page.test.tsx` ‚Äî test that renders the home page and finds the text "DevCard"
- [ ] `npm test` passes; `npm run build` succeeds

## Dependencies

None ‚Äî this is the first issue.

## Technical Notes

- Use Next.js 14 App Router (not Pages Router)
- TypeScript strict mode: `"strict": true` in tsconfig
- Path alias `@/*` ‚Üí `src/*` must work in both TypeScript and Next.js
- Vitest needs `@vitejs/plugin-react` and `jsdom` environment for React component tests
- The `vitest.config.ts` setup: `globals: true`, `environment: "jsdom"`, `setupFiles: ["./src/test-setup.ts"]`
- Create `src/test-setup.ts` importing `@testing-library/jest-dom/vitest`

issues.title: [Pipeline] GitHub Data Layer ‚Äî Types, Fixtures, and API Fetching
issues.body:
## Description

Implement the GitHub data-fetching layer including TypeScript type definitions, fixture data for offline/test use, and the async functions that fetch and aggregate user data from the GitHub API.

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] `src/data/types.ts` ‚Äî TypeScript interfaces:
  - `GitHubUser`: `login`, `name`, `avatarUrl`, `bio`, `company`, `location`, `blog`, `twitterUsername`, `publicRepos`, `followers`, `following`, `createdAt`
  - `GitHubRepo`: `name`, `description`, `language`, `stargazerCount`, `forkCount`, `updatedAt`, `url`, `topics` (`string[]`)
  - `LanguageStat`: `name`, `percentage`, `color` (hex string), `bytes`
  - `ContributionStats`: `totalContributions`, `currentStreak`, `longestStreak`, `contributionsLastYear` (all numbers)
  - `DevCardData`: `user` (GitHubUser), `topRepos` (GitHubRepo[]), `languages` (LanguageStat[]), `contributions` (ContributionStats)
- [ ] `src/data/fixtures/sample-user.json` ‚Äî fixture data for username `"octocat"` with realistic values: 6 repos, 5 languages with percentages summing to 100, contribution stats
- [ ] `src/data/github.ts` ‚Äî `async function fetchGitHubUser(username: string): Promise(DevCardData)`:
  - Fetches user profile via `GET /users/{username}`
  - Fetches top 20 repos sorted by stars via `GET /users/{username}/repos?sort=stars&per_page=20`
  - Computes language breakdown by iterating repos, calling `GET /repos/{owner}/{repo}/languages` for top 6 repos, aggregating byte counts, computing percentages
  - Returns estimated contribution stats derived from public events or profile data
  - Uses `GITHUB_TOKEN` env var if available (via `auth` option in Octokit constructor)
- [ ] `src/data/index.ts` ‚Äî `async function getDevCardData(username: string): Promise(DevCardData)`:
  - Calls `fetchGitHubUser(username)`
  - On any error (including 404, rate limit 403), falls back to fixture data for `"octocat"` or throws for other usernames
  - Logs whether live API or fixture data was used
- [ ] Unit tests in `src/data/__tests__/github.test.ts`:
  - `getDevCardData("octocat")` returns fixture data when the API throws
  - Fixture JSON parses correctly and satisfies the `DevCardData` shape (all required fields present)
- [ ] `npm test` passes

## Dependencies

Depends on #63

## Technical Notes

- Use `@octokit/rest` `Octokit` class: `new Octokit({ auth: process.env.GITHUB_TOKEN })`
- Language bytes from `/repos/{owner}/{repo}/languages` returns `{ [lang: string]: number }` ‚Äî aggregate across all fetched repos
- Convert byte totals to percentages; sort descending; include top 6 languages
- For contribution stats: approximate `totalContributions` from `public_repos * 50 + followers * 2` or similar heuristic (real GraphQL API is out of scope)
- Fixture file lives at `src/data/fixtures/sample-user.json` and is imported via `import fixture from "@/data/fixtures/sample-user.json"`
- All TypeScript types must be `export`ed from `src/data/types.ts`
- No `any` types allowed
Related to #62

issues.title: [Pipeline] Navigation Bar and Landing Page with Username Form
issues.body:
## Description

Build the shared navigation bar and the landing page hero section, username input form, "how it works" steps, and an example card preview. This is the entry point for all users.

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] `src/components/nav-bar.tsx` ‚Äî sticky horizontal nav bar:
  - `üÉè DevCard` logo/text on the left
  - Home (`/`) and Gallery (`/gallery`) links on the right using `next/link`
  - Active link highlighted (use `usePathname()` from `next/navigation`)
  - `sticky top-0 z-50`, `bg-gray-900/80 backdrop-blur`, height `h-16`, full-width
- [ ] `src/app/layout.tsx` updated to render `(NavBar /)` above all page children
- [ ] `src/app/page.tsx` ‚Äî landing page with four sections:
  1. **Hero**: Large `"DevCard"` heading, subtitle `"Generate beautiful developer identity cards from any GitHub profile"`, dark gradient `bg-gradient-to-b from-gray-950 to-gray-900`
  2. **Username Input Form**: `"@"` prefix icon, `placeholder="Enter GitHub username"`, submit button `"Generate Card"`. On submit, router navigates to `/card/{username}` using `next/navigation` `useRouter`
  3. **"How it works"**: 3-step horizontal cards ‚Äî `"1. Enter Username"` (üîç), `"2. We Fetch Your Data"` (‚¨áÔ∏è), `"3. Get Your Card"` (üÉè). 3-column grid on desktop, stacked on mobile
  4. **Example preview**: The `octocat` sample card (using fixture data) rendered at 60% scale, with a `"Try it ‚Üí"` link to `/card/octocat`
- [ ] Responsive: hero stacks vertically on mobile; step cards use `grid-cols-1 md:grid-cols-3`
- [ ] Framer Motion: hero title `fadeIn` on mount; step cards stagger up from `y:20` with 0.1s delay between each
- [ ] `src/app/__tests__/landing.test.tsx` ‚Äî test that the landing page renders the username input field and all three step titles (`"Enter Username"`, `"We Fetch Your Data"`, `"Get Your Card"`)
- [ ] `npm test` passes

## Dependencies

Depends on #63, #64

## Technical Notes

- Landing page must be a `"use client"` component (uses `useRouter` and Framer Motion)
- For the example card preview in the hero, import fixture data and pass to `DevCard` component (which will be created in a later issue ‚Äî use a placeholder `(div)` initially, or add the DevCard import once #66 is merged)
- `usePathname()` from `next/navigation` requires `"use client"` in the NavBar component
- Framer Motion: wrap step cards in `(motion.div)` with `variants` for stagger. Use `AnimatePresence` if needed
- For the input form: controlled input with `useState`, on submit prevent default and call `router.push(\`/card/\\$\{username.trim()}\`)`

issues.title: [Pipeline] Card Component ‚Äî Profile Section (Avatar, Bio, Stats)
issues.body:
## Description

Build the core DevCard wrapper component and the profile section displaying the user's avatar, name, bio, location, company, and stats. This is the visual foundation the other card sections (language bar, repos) will attach to.

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] `src/components/card/dev-card.tsx` ‚Äî main card wrapper:
  - Props: `data: DevCardData`, `theme: string`
  - Fixed aspect ratio `400√ó560px` at 1x scale
  - `rounded-2xl`, `overflow-hidden`, `data-card-root` attribute (for PNG export targeting)
  - Renders profile section, language bar (placeholder for now), and top repos (placeholder) in vertical stack
- [ ] Profile section (inside `dev-card.tsx` or extracted to `src/components/card/profile-section.tsx`):
  - Circular `next/image` avatar: `96px`, `rounded-full`, `border-2` with theme accent color
  - `alt` text set to `"{name}'s avatar"` (accessibility)
  - Display name in bold (`text-xl`), login in muted text below (`@{login}`)
  - Bio text if present, truncated to 2 lines (`line-clamp-2`); hidden when `bio` is `null`
  - Location and company row with icons (üìç map pin, üè¢ building); each hidden when `null`; never renders the string `"null"`
  - Stats row: `"{publicRepos} repos"`, `"{followers} followers"`, `"{following} following"` in a `flex` row with dividers (`|`)
- [ ] Framer Motion: card content staggers in from `y:20` on mount, each section 0.1s apart
- [ ] `src/components/card/__tests__/dev-card.test.tsx`:
  - Renders avatar `img` with correct `alt`
  - Renders display name and `@login`
  - Renders stats row with correct repo/follower counts from fixture data
  - When `bio` is `null`, the bio element is NOT in the DOM
- [ ] `npm test` passes

## Dependencies

Depends on #64

## Technical Notes

- Import `DevCardData` from `@/data/types`
- Use `next/image` for the avatar; the domain `avatars.githubusercontent.com` is already allowlisted in `next.config.js`
- Theme colors will be wired up fully in #69 ‚Äî for now accept a `theme` string prop and apply a placeholder dark blue background
- The `data-card-root` attribute is used by `html-to-image` in the export feature: `(div data-card-root ...)`
- Use `"use client"` directive because Framer Motion requires client-side rendering
- For testing, mock `next/image` if needed: `vi.mock("next/image", () => ({ default: (props) => (img {...props} /) }))`

issues.title: [Pipeline] Card Component ‚Äî Language Breakdown Bar and Color Map
issues.body:
## Description

Build the language breakdown bar and legend showing a user's top programming languages as colored segments. Includes the language-to-color mapping data file.

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] `src/data/language-colors.ts` ‚Äî exported `const LANGUAGE_COLORS: Record(string, string)` mapping the top 30 GitHub languages to hex colors. Must include at minimum:
  `JavaScript: "#f1e05a"`, `TypeScript: "#3178c6"`, `Python: "#3572A5"`, `Ruby: "#701516"`, `Go: "#00ADD8"`, `Rust: "#dea584"`, `Java: "#b07219"`, `C: "#555555"`, `"C++": "#f34b7d"`, `"C#": "#178600"`, `PHP: "#4F5D95"`, `Swift: "#F05138"`, `Kotlin: "#A97BFF"`, `Scala: "#c22d40"`, `Shell: "#89e051"`, `HTML: "#e34c26"`, `CSS: "#563d7c"`, `Vue: "#41b883"`, `Dart: "#00B4AB"`, `Elixir: "#6e4a7e"`, `Haskell: "#5e5086"`, `Lua: "#000080"`, `MATLAB: "#e16737"`, `R: "#198CE7"`, `Perl: "#0298c3"` ‚Äî plus 5 more of choice. Unknown languages default to `"#8b8b8b"`.
- [ ] `src/components/card/language-bar.tsx` ‚Äî horizontal stacked bar:
  - Props: `languages: LanguageStat[]`
  - Groups top 5 languages; remaining aggregated as `"Other"` with color `"#8b8b8b"`
  - Each segment width proportional to percentage; minimum width `3%`
  - Bar height `8px`, `rounded-full` on full bar, individual segments butted together
  - Legend below the bar: 2-column grid with colored dot, language name, percentage
  - When `languages` is empty or undefined, renders `"No language data"` placeholder in muted text
- [ ] Framer Motion: each bar segment animates width from `0` to final on mount (0.5s, stagger 0.05s per segment)
- [ ] `src/components/card/__tests__/language-bar.test.tsx`:
  - Renders correct number of legend items for fixture data (‚â§5 + possibly "Other")
  - When more than 5 languages in input, `"Other"` appears in the legend
  - When `languages` is empty array, `"No language data"` is rendered
- [ ] `npm test` passes

## Dependencies

Depends on #64

## Technical Notes

- `LanguageStat.color` from the API layer may be `"#8b8b8b"` for unknown languages; `LANGUAGE_COLORS` provides the canonical colors
- Segment widths: compute `Math.max(3, percentage)` for display, then normalize so total = 100%
- Framer Motion width animation: use `initial={{ width: 0 }}` ‚Üí `animate={{ width: \`\${displayPercent}%\` }}`; set `style={{ backgroundColor: color }}`
- The "Other" entry should use percentage = `100 - sum(top5percentages)`
- Export `LANGUAGE_COLORS` as a named export so it can be used elsewhere (themes, tests)
Related to #62

issues.title: [Pipeline] Card Component ‚Äî Top Repositories List
issues.body:
## Description

Build the top repositories section of the DevCard, displaying the user's top 3 repos by star count in a compact format within the card.

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] `src/components/card/top-repos.tsx` ‚Äî compact repo list:

    - Description truncated to 1 line (`line-clamp-1`, `text-xs`, muted); hidden when `description` is null
    - Stats row (`text-xs`, flex): colored language dot + language name, `‚≠ê {stargazerCount}`, `üç¥ {forkCount}`

  - Empty `repos` array shows `"No public repositories"` text

issues.title: [Pipeline] Card Themes ‚Äî Theme Data, DevCard Theming, and Theme Selector
issues.body:
## Description

Define the 6 card themes, wire them into the DevCard component so all card elements respect the active theme, and build the theme selector swatch row.

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] `src/data/themes.ts` ‚Äî `export const THEMES: Theme[]` with `Theme` interface: `{ id: string; name: string; background: string; textPrimary: string; textSecondary: string; accentColor: string; borderColor: string }`. Six themes:
  1. `"midnight"` ‚Äî `background: "linear-gradient(135deg, #0f172a, #1e293b)"`, white text, accent `"#3b82f6"` (blue). **Default.**
  2. `"aurora"` ‚Äî `background: "linear-gradient(135deg, #064e3b, #312e81)"`, white text, accent `"#10b981"` (emerald)
  3. `"sunset"` ‚Äî `background: "linear-gradient(135deg, #1c1917, #431407)"`, warm white text, accent `"#f97316"` (orange)
  4. `"neon"` ‚Äî `background: "#000000"`, white text, accent `"#ec4899"` (hot pink), `borderColor: "0 0 0 1px #ec4899, 0 0 20px #ec4899"` (glow via `box-shadow`)
  5. `"arctic"` ‚Äî `background: "linear-gradient(135deg, #f8fafc, #e2e8f0)"`, dark text `"#0f172a"`, accent `"#0ea5e9"` (sky blue)
  6. `"mono"` ‚Äî `background: "#18181b"`, white text, accent `"#ffffff"`, no gradient
- [ ] `src/components/card/dev-card.tsx` updated to look up the active `Theme` by `props.theme` (defaulting to `"midnight"`), and apply theme colors inline:
  - Card `style={{ background: theme.background }}`
  - Avatar border color via `style={{ borderColor: theme.accentColor }}`
  - Stats/accent numbers via `style={{ color: theme.accentColor }}`
  - Text colors via `style={{ color: theme.textPrimary }}` and `theme.textSecondary`
  - Neon theme: apply `boxShadow` to card root
- [ ] `src/components/card/theme-selector.tsx`:
  - Props: `currentTheme: string`, `onChange: (themeId: string) => void`
  - Row of 6 circular swatches (`24px` each)
  - Each swatch shows the theme gradient as `background` CSS
  - Active theme has a white `ring-2` indicator using Framer Motion `layoutId="theme-ring"` for animated transition
  - Clicking a swatch calls `onChange(theme.id)`
- [ ] `src/components/card/__tests__/themes.test.tsx`:
  - All 6 theme swatches render
  - Switching theme to `"neon"` applies the neon accent color to the card
- [ ] `npm test` passes

## Dependencies

Depends on #66, #67, #68

## Technical Notes

- `dev-card.tsx` should use `THEMES.find(t => t.id === theme) ?? THEMES[0]` to resolve the active theme
- For the `"neon"` glow border: apply `boxShadow: "0 0 0 1px #ec4899, 0 0 20px #ec4899"` on the card root `div`
- ThemeSelector needs `"use client"` for the click handler
- `layoutId="theme-ring"` on the selection indicator enables Framer Motion's shared layout animation (ring smoothly moves between swatches)
- Both `DevCard` and `ThemeSelector` are client components
Related to #62

issues.title: [Pipeline] Card Generator Page ‚Äî /card/[username] Dynamic Route
issues.body:
## Description

Build the `/card/[username]` dynamic route page that fetches GitHub data server-side, renders the themed DevCard, provides theme selection, and links to export controls. This is the primary user-facing page.

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] `src/app/card/[username]/page.tsx` ‚Äî dynamic route (server component wrapper + client card area):
  - Fetches `DevCardData` server-side via `getDevCardData(username)` from `@/data`
  - Renders `(DevCard)` centered on page with `max-w-md mx-auto`
  - Renders `(ThemeSelector)` below the card; theme state managed in a client wrapper component
  - Renders export buttons from Feature 9 (placeholder if not yet merged ‚Äî a `(div)` with `"Export controls coming soon"`)
  - Shows `"Share"` section: label `"Share this card"` + read-only text input containing the current page URL
  - `"Generate Another"` link back to `/`
- [ ] **Loading state**: `src/app/card/[username]/loading.tsx` ‚Äî card-sized skeleton (`w-[400px] h-[560px] rounded-2xl bg-gray-800 animate-pulse`)
- [ ] **Error/not-found state**: if `getDevCardData` throws for an unknown username, catch and render a friendly `"User @{username} not found"` message with a link back to `/`; use Next.js `notFound()` or error boundary
- [ ] Page metadata (via `generateMetadata`): title `"DevCard ‚Äî @{username}"`, description `"Developer identity card for @{username}"`, `openGraph.images` pointing to `/api/og/{username}`
- [ ] Responsive: `px-4` on mobile, centered on desktop
- [ ] Framer Motion: card and controls `fadeIn` together (`opacity: 0 ‚Üí 1`, `y: 20 ‚Üí 0`, `duration: 0.4`)
- [ ] `src/app/card/__tests__/page.test.tsx`:
  - Renders the DevCard for fixture data (mock `getDevCardData` to return fixture)
  - Shows error state when `getDevCardData` throws a 404-like error
- [ ] `npm test` passes

## Dependencies

Depends on #69, #65

## Technical Notes

- Because `DevCard` and `ThemeSelector` are client components, create a `src/app/card/[username]/card-view.tsx` client component that owns the `theme` state and renders both `DevCard` and `ThemeSelector`
- The page itself (`page.tsx`) can be a server component that fetches data and passes it to `(CardView data={data} /)`
- For the share URL: use `headers()` from `next/headers` to get the host, or render it client-side with `window.location.href`
- `generateMetadata` is an async server function: `export async function generateMetadata({ params }) { return { title: \`DevCard ‚Äî @\${params.username}\` } }`
- Error handling: wrap `getDevCardData` in try/catch; use `notFound()` from `next/navigation` on 404 errors

issues.title: [Pipeline] Card Export ‚Äî Download PNG and Copy Link Buttons
issues.body:
## Description

Implement PNG export of the rendered DevCard using `html-to-image`, and a "Copy Link" button for sharing. These controls appear below the theme selector on the card page.

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] `src/lib/export.ts` ‚Äî `async function exportCardAsPng(element: HTMLElement, username: string): Promise(void)`:
  - Uses `html-to-image`'s `toPng` with `{ width: 800, height: 1120, pixelRatio: 2 }` to render at 2x
  - Sets `fetchRequestInit: { mode: "cors" }` to handle avatar image CORS
  - Creates a temporary `(a)` element with `href = data URL`, `download = "devcard-{username}.png"`, clicks it, then removes it
- [ ] `src/components/card/export-button.tsx` ‚Äî client component with two buttons:
  1. **"Download PNG"** button:
     - Styled with theme accent color (prop: `accentColor: string`)
     - On click: calls `exportCardAsPng(document.querySelector("[data-card-root]"), username)`
     - Shows `"Downloading..."` label while in progress (disable button)
     - Shows `"‚úì Downloaded"` for 2s after success, then reverts to `"Download PNG"`
  2. **"Copy Link"** button:
     - Copies `window.location.href` via `navigator.clipboard.writeText()`
     - Shows `"Copied!"` confirmation for 2s, then reverts
  - Both buttons in a `flex gap-3` row
- [ ] `src/components/card/__tests__/export-button.test.tsx`:
  - Renders both buttons
  - Clicking "Copy Link" calls `navigator.clipboard.writeText` with the correct URL
- [ ] `npm test` passes

## Dependencies

Depends on #70

## Technical Notes

- `export-button.tsx` must be `"use client"` (uses `document`, `navigator.clipboard`, React state)

issues.title: [Pipeline] OG Image API Route ‚Äî Social Media Preview Image Generation
issues.body:
## Description

Build a serverless API route that generates a 1200√ó630 Open Graph image for social media previews when a DevCard URL is shared. Uses `@vercel/og`'s `ImageResponse`.

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] `src/app/api/og/[username]/route.ts` ‚Äî Next.js Route Handler:
  - Fetches `DevCardData` via `getDevCardData(username)`
  - Returns `ImageResponse` (from `@vercel/og`) at `1200√ó630px` with:
    - Dark `"midnight"` background (`#0f172a`)
    - Left: circular avatar (`128px`), user name (bold, white, `32px`), login (muted, `20px`), bio (muted, `16px`, clamp to 2 lines)
    - Right: top 3 language names with colored dots and percentages stacked vertically
    - Bottom: a thin horizontal language bar (approximate ‚Äî use flex divs with background colors and proportional flex-basis)
    - `"DevCard"` watermark text in bottom-right corner (muted, small)
  - Sets response header `Cache-Control: public, max-age=86400, s-maxage=86400`
  - Returns `NextResponse` with status `404` and body `"User not found"` if both API and fixture data fail
- [ ] `src/app/card/[username]/page.tsx` updated: `generateMetadata` sets `openGraph.images = [{ url: \`/api/og/\${username}\`, width: 1200, height: 630 }]`
- [ ] `src/app/api/og/__tests__/og.test.ts`:
  - GET `/api/og/octocat` returns a response with `Content-Type: image/png`
- [ ] `npm test` passes

## Dependencies

Depends on #64

## Technical Notes

- `@vercel/og` is already in `package.json` (added in scaffold issue)
- Import: `import { ImageResponse } from "`@vercel/og`"`
- Route file must export `export const runtime = "edge"` for `@vercel/og` to work correctly
- `ImageResponse` accepts JSX (React elements) as its first argument ‚Äî use inline styles (no Tailwind in edge runtime)
- For avatar in OG image: use a standard `(img)` element (not `next/image`), set `src` to `user.avatarUrl`
- Language bar: render as `(div style={{ display: "flex" }})` with child divs, each having `flex: "0 0 {percentage}%"` and the language color as `backgroundColor`
- If testing the route handler directly is complex, at minimum test that it returns a 200 for a mocked username

issues.title: [Pipeline] Gallery Page ‚Äî Grid of Notable Developer DevCards
issues.body:
## Description

Build the `/gallery` page that shows a grid of pre-rendered DevCards for 8 notable GitHub developers, demonstrating the variety of card outputs and driving discovery.

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] `src/data/gallery-users.ts` ‚Äî `export const GALLERY_USERS: GalleryUser[]` with `GalleryUser = { username: string; tagline: string }`. Eight entries:
  - `{ username: "torvalds", tagline: "Creator of Linux and Git" }`
  - `{ username: "gaearon", tagline: "Co-creator of React and Redux" }`
  - `{ username: "sindresorhus", tagline: "Prolific open-source maintainer" }`
  - `{ username: "addyosmani", tagline: "Engineering manager at Google Chrome" }`
  - `{ username: "kentcdodds", tagline: "Creator of Testing Library" }`
  - `{ username: "sarah-edo", tagline: "Core Vue.js team member" }`
  - `{ username: "ThePrimeagen", tagline: "Developer educator and Neovim advocate" }`
  - `{ username: "octocat", tagline: "GitHub's mascot" }`
- [ ] `src/app/gallery/page.tsx` ‚Äî gallery page (server component):
  - Fetches `DevCardData` for all 8 users via `Promise.allSettled([...GALLERY_USERS.map(u => getDevCardData(u.username))])` ‚Äî silently skips failed fetches
  - Page heading `"Gallery"` (`text-3xl font-bold`) with subtitle `"Cards generated for notable developers"` (muted)
  - Cards grid: `grid-cols-2 sm:grid-cols-3 lg:grid-cols-4 gap-6`
  - Each gallery card:
    - `(DevCard)` rendered at 75% scale using `transform: scale(0.75)` with `transformOrigin: "top center"` in a fixed-height wrapper
    - Wrapped in a `next/link` to `/card/{username}`
    - Tagline text below the card (`text-sm`, muted, center-aligned)
  - Cards that failed to fetch are omitted
- [ ] Framer Motion: cards stagger in on page load (0.05s per card, `y: 20 ‚Üí 0`)
- [ ] Page metadata: `title: "Gallery ‚Äî DevCard"`, `description: "DevCards for notable developers"`
- [ ] `src/app/gallery/__tests__/gallery.test.tsx`:
  - Gallery page renders the `"Gallery"` heading
  - At least one card renders when fixture data is used (mock `getDevCardData`)
- [ ] `npm test` passes

## Dependencies

Depends on #69

## Technical Notes

- Since `DevCard` is a client component and gallery is a server component, wrap each card in a server-compatible container; the `DevCard` itself will hydrate on the client
- For gallery, the default theme `"midnight"` is used for all cards
- The scale transform causes the card to occupy less visual space ‚Äî the wrapper div should have `height: 400px` (75% of 560) and `overflow: hidden` to contain the scaled card
- `Promise.allSettled` returns `PromiseSettledResult[]`; filter for `status === "fulfilled"` to get the data
- The gallery page can be statically generated (`export const revalidate = 3600` for hourly refresh of API data)

issues.title: [Pipeline] DevCard missing LanguageBar and TopRepos ‚Äî empty placeholders never wired up
issues.body:
## Description

The `DevCard` component (`src/components/card/dev-card.tsx`) renders empty `<motion.div>` placeholder elements where the `LanguageBar` and `TopRepos` components should appear. Both components are fully implemented in their own files but are never imported or rendered inside `DevCard`.

This causes every generated card (e.g. `/card/samuelkahessay`, `/card/octocat`) to show only the profile header (avatar, name, bio, stats) with a blank lower half. The language breakdown and top repos ‚Äî two key features ‚Äî are invisible to users.

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] `LanguageBar` component is imported and rendered inside `DevCard`, receiving `data.languages` as its `languages` prop
- [ ] `TopRepos` component is imported and rendered inside `DevCard`, receiving `data.topRepos` as its `repos` prop
- [ ] The placeholder `{/* Language Bar Placeholder */}` and `{/* Top Repos Placeholder */}` divs are replaced with actual component renders (keep the motion animation wrappers)
- [ ] Cards for any valid GitHub username display language bar and top repos sections
- [ ] The card layout still fits within the 400√ó560px card dimensions without overflow

## Technical Notes

- `DevCard` component: `src/components/card/dev-card.tsx` (lines 111-125 are the empty placeholders)
- `LanguageBar` component: `src/components/card/language-bar.tsx` ‚Äî accepts `{ languages: LanguageStat[] }`
- `TopRepos` component: `src/components/card/top-repos.tsx` ‚Äî accepts `{ repos: GitHubRepo[] }`
- The `DevCardData` type already includes `languages: LanguageStat[]` and `topRepos: GitHubRepo[]`
- The `data` prop is already passed to `DevCard` ‚Äî just destructure `languages` and `topRepos` from `data`
- Keep the `motion.div` animation wrappers (delay 0.2 for languages, 0.3 for repos) and add the components as children

issues.title: [Pipeline] Gallery cards clip text ‚Äî overflow on scaled cards
issues.body:
## Description

Gallery cards clip/truncate content on the right edge and bottom. Bios, location badges, follower counts, and repo sections are all visually cut off. This happens because:

1. The gallery renders each `DevCard` at `scale(0.75)` inside a container with `height: 400` and `overflow: hidden`
2. The full card is 400√ó560px. At 0.75 scale that's 300√ó420px ‚Äî already taller than the 400px container
3. Now that LanguageBar and TopRepos are rendered (previously empty placeholders), the card content exceeds 560px for many users, causing even more bottom clipping
4. The scaled card is 300px wide but the grid column width varies ‚Äî on wider screens content clips on the right

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] All gallery card text is fully visible ‚Äî no horizontal or vertical clipping
- [ ] Cards with long bios, locations, or company names gracefully truncate with ellipsis inside the card (not clipped by the outer container)
- [ ] The gallery grid remains responsive across screen sizes (2 cols mobile, 3 cols tablet, 4 cols desktop)
- [ ] Bottom of cards (repo sections) are visible, not clipped by the container

## Technical Notes

- Gallery grid component: `src/app/gallery/gallery-grid.tsx`
- The outer container (line 29): `style={{ height: 400, overflow: "hidden", position: "relative" }}`
- The scale wrapper (line 30): `style={{ transform: "scale(0.75)", transformOrigin: "top center" }}`
- Fix approach: increase the container height to fit the scaled card (560 √ó 0.75 = 420px minimum), or use `transform-origin: top left` with a width-constrained wrapper, or reduce scale factor
- The `DevCard` component itself handles internal text truncation (WebkitLineClamp on bio) ‚Äî the issue is the outer gallery container, not the card

issues.title: [Pipeline] DevCard has no visual separation from page background
issues.body:
## Description

On the card generator page (/card/[username]), the DevCard component's Midnight theme background (dark blue gradient #0f172a ‚Üí #1e293b) is nearly identical to the page background. There is no visible border, shadow, or contrast to distinguish the card from the surrounding page, making it look like the card content is floating without a container.

This affects all dark themes (Midnight, Aurora, Sunset, Neon, Mono) since the page background is also dark.

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] The DevCard has a clearly visible border or shadow that separates it from the page background
- [ ] The separation looks good across all 6 themes (Midnight, Aurora, Sunset, Neon, Mono, Arctic)
- [ ] The visual treatment is subtle and polished ‚Äî not heavy-handed (e.g. a soft box-shadow or thin border, not a thick bright outline)
- [ ] The card still looks good on the gallery page (where cards already have their own visual context)

## Technical Notes

- DevCard component: `src/components/card/dev-card.tsx`
- The card root div (line 19-35) uses inline styles with `borderRadius: "1rem"` but no `boxShadow` or `border` (except Neon theme which has a glow)
- Each theme defines `borderColor` in `src/data/themes.ts` ‚Äî this is already used for the avatar border but not for the card itself
- Suggested fix: add a subtle `boxShadow` (e.g. `0 0 0 1px rgba(255,255,255,0.1), 0 4px 24px rgba(0,0,0,0.3)`) or use the theme's `borderColor` as a `border` on the card root
- The Neon theme already has a `boxShadow` glow effect ‚Äî ensure any new shadow doesn't conflict with it

issues.title: [Pipeline] Share URL input shows wrong path on card page
issues.body:
## Description

On the card generator page (/card/[username]), the "Share this card" URL input displays the root URL (e.g. \`http://localhost:3001/\`) instead of the full card URL (e.g. \`http://localhost:3001/card/samuelkahessay\`).

The current code uses \`window.location.href\` which should work on the client, but there appears to be a hydration mismatch causing the value to not update after the initial server render.

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] The share URL input displays the correct full card URL (e.g. \`/card/{username}\` or the full absolute URL)
- [ ] The URL is correct on initial page load (no flash of wrong value)
- [ ] The URL works when copied ‚Äî it navigates to the correct card page

## Technical Notes

- Component: \`src/app/card/[username]/card-view.tsx\` (line 35)
- Current code: \`value={typeof window !== "undefined" ? window.location.href : \`/card/\${username}\`}\`
- The issue is likely a React hydration mismatch ‚Äî the server renders the fallback (\`/card/{username}\`) but then the client picks up a stale or incorrect \`window.location.href\`
- Fix approach: use a \`useEffect\` + \`useState\` to read \`window.location.href\` after mount, or simply use the deterministic value \`/card/\${username}\` which doesn't depend on \`window\` at all. Since the canonical URL format is known, the latter is simpler and SSR-safe.
- If using the deterministic approach, consider constructing the full URL using an environment variable or \`usePathname()\` from \`next/navigation\`

pull_requests.title: [Pipeline] OG Image API Route ‚Äî Social Media Preview Image Generation
pull_requests.body:
Closes #72

## Summary

Implements the OG Image API route that generates 1200√ó630 Open Graph images for social media previews when DevCard URLs are shared.

### Files Added

- **`src/app/api/og/[username]/route.tsx`** ‚Äî Next.js Route Handler with `runtime = "edge"`:
  - Fetches `DevCardData` via `getDevCardData(username)`, falls back to 404 on failure
  - Returns `ImageResponse` (from `@vercel/og`) at 1200√ó630px with:
    - Dark `"midnight"` background (`#0f172a`)
    - Left: circular avatar (128px), name (bold/32px), login (muted/20px), bio (2-line clamp)
    - Right: top 3 languages with colored dots + percentages
    - Bottom: proportional language bar using flex divs + "DevCard" watermark
  - Sets `Cache-Control: public, max-age=86400, s-maxage=86400`
  - Returns 404 + "User not found" if fetch fails

- **`src/app/api/og/__tests__/og.test.ts`** ‚Äî Tests:
  - GET `/api/og/octocat` returns `Content-Type: image/png`
  - GET `/api/og/unknown` returns 404 when data fetch fails

pull_requests.title: [Pipeline] Fix share URL input ‚Äî resolve SSR hydration mismatch on card page
pull_requests.body:
Closes #104

## Changes

Fixed the hydration mismatch in the share URL input on the card page.

**Root cause:** The component was reading `window.location.href` inline during render, which doesn't work during SSR and causes React to output a different value than the server-rendered fallback, resulting in the root URL `/` being displayed.

**Fix:** Used `useState` (initialized to the deterministic `/card/${username}`) + `useEffect` to update to `window.location.href` after mount. This is SSR-safe and avoids the hydration mismatch.

- `src/app/card/[username]/card-view.tsx`: Added `useEffect` import and `shareUrl` state; replaced inline `window.location.href` check with the state value

## Test Results

All 29 tests pass. ‚úÖ

---
*This PR was created by Pipeline Assistant.*

pull_requests.title: [Pipeline] Fix gallery card clipping ‚Äî correct container dimensions for scaled cards
pull_requests.body:
Closes #101

## Changes

Fixed the gallery card container so scaled DevCards are no longer clipped.

**Root cause:** The DevCard is 400√ó560px. At `scale(0.75)` it renders at 300√ó420px. The container was 400px tall (`height: 400`) ‚Äî too short for the 420px scaled card ‚Äî and used `transform-origin: top center` which caused horizontal clipping on narrower columns.

**Fix:**
- Container dimensions changed to `width: 300, height: 420` (exactly matching the scaled card output: 400√ó0.75 = 300, 560√ó0.75 = 420)
- `transform-origin` changed from `top center` to `top left` so the scale anchor matches the container's top-left corner, preventing any horizontal overflow

- `src/app/gallery/gallery-grid.tsx`: Updated container dimensions and transform-origin

## Test Results

All 29 tests pass. ‚úÖ

---
*This PR was created by Pipeline Assistant.*

pull_requests.title: [Pipeline] Fix share URL input showing wrong path on card page
pull_requests.body:
Closes #104

## Changes

Fixed share URL hydration mismatch on the card page. The previous `window.location.href` inline expression caused the server to render `/card/${username}` while the client sometimes picked up a stale value.

**Fix:** Added `useEffect` + `useState` to read `window.location.href` after mount, initializing with the SSR-safe `/card/${username}` and updating to the full URL (`${window.location.origin}/card/${username}`) on the client.

**File changed:** `src/app/card/[username]/card-view.tsx`

## Test Results

All 29 tests pass (`npm test`).
